et: Middle English, of Scandinavian origin; akin to Icelandic {it}karpa{/it} to dispute
shortdef: to find fault or complain querulously

dt: {bc}a large variable Asian soft-finned freshwater cyprinid fish ({it}Cyprinus carpio{/it}) of sluggish waters that is often raised for food and has been widely introduced into U.S. waters
{bc}any of various related cyprinid fishes (such as the grass carp)
{bc}a fish (such as the European sea bream) resembling a carp

et: Middle English {it}carpe{/it}, from Middle French, from Late Latin {it}carpa{/it}, probably of Germanic origin; akin to Old High German {it}karpfo{/it} carp
shortdef: a large variable Asian soft-finned freshwater cyprinid fish (Cyprinus carpio) of sluggish waters that is often raised for food and has been widely introduced into U.S. waters; also : any of various related cyprinid fishes (such as the grass carp)
a fish (such as the European sea bream) resembling a carp

et: French & New Latin, from Greek {it}karp-, karpo-{/it}, from {it}karpos{/it} {ma}{mat|harvest|}{/ma}

dt: {bc}any of several freshwater, {d_link|cyprinid|cyprinid} fishes (such as the {d_link|grass carp|grass carp}) that are native to Asia and were accidentally introduced into U.S. waters where they have spread widely and are considered detrimental to native fish stock due to their voracious appetite and rapid rate of reproduction

shortdef: any of several freshwater, cyprinid fishes (such as the grass carp) that are native to Asia and were accidentally introduced into U.S. waters where they have spread widely and are considered detrimental to native fish stock due to their voracious appetite and rapid rate of reproduction

et: modification of Low German {it}karuse{/it}, from Middle Low German {it}karusse{/it}, perhaps of Baltic origin; akin to Lithuanian {it}karušis{/it} carp
shortdef: a European cyprinid fish (Carassius carassius) —called also crucian

dt: {bc}an herbivorous cyprinid fish ({it}Ctenopharyngodon idella{/it}) of eastern Asia that has been introduced elsewhere to control aquatic weeds

shortdef: an herbivorous cyprinid fish (Ctenopharyngodon idella) of eastern Asia that has been introduced elsewhere to control aquatic weeds —called also white amur
